CatDescriptText: Sadie Allen, housewife, 2114 Bentley Drive, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 17, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe that city patrolmen and firemen should be required to work more than 40 hours per week?" answer reads: "If they don't get paid, they should. Everybody else receives overtime pay and this should apply to policemen and firemen too, because they are risking their lives..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Sadie Allen wearing light colored top with two buttons at neck, and dark skirt, holding flowers and donation can for Wesley AME Zion Church, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, with Thrift Drugs in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
